text: today I'm making a 15 minute dinner that
is a classic Chinese restaurant favorite
egg drop soup really really easy and I'm
not kidding you when I say it only takes
15 minutes I have three and a half cups
of low-sodium chicken broth in this pot
and I'm adding three cups of water then
add 2 teaspoons of grated ginger peel
your ginger and then grade it on your
rasp grater and 4 teaspoons of soy sauce
this is I know I'm like living life on
the edge because I'm measuring my soy
sauce right over my pot you want to heat
this till it's boiling and while it's
coming to a boil you can prep some more
ingredients I have 8 ounces of snow peas
here if you don't have snow peas you
could use sugar snap peas if you wanted
to just trim the ends and then cut them
into 1-inch pieces you know what else
you could use here bok choy or baby bok
choy that would be really great any nice
sort of crisp green that's not going to
wilt down too much would be fantastic
these snow peas are great for spring I
think it's finally spring felt like it
would never come am i right whatever
vegetable you choose you should have
about 1 and 1/2 cups I would say of
chopped up veg do a mix - the world is
your oyster and then the eggs for the
egg drop soup no egg drop soup would be
complete without eggs 3 large eggs and
then you want to beat them pretty well
fully combined and when you stir this
into the soup long strands of egg will
cook like that immediately in your soup
you'll see and then there's one final
thing just some scallions to finish the
soup off this is more of a garnish but
it'll give a nice flavor right at the
end of fresh oniony flavor but nice and
mild if you wanted to further season
your soup base you could add a clove or
two of garlic to the broth that would be
nice ok let's finish the soup it's that
easy
since the broth is simmering I'm going
to add my snow peas directly into the
pot and then add one and a half cups of
mung bean sprouts pop sprouts that's
what helps you guys you can cut back if

to come to a boil and then you're going
to see something really amazing
the soup with the veg have simmered and
now it's time to add your egg have it

turn into sort of feathery I was going

hooked done you should turn your heat
off season your soup with rice vinegar
and toasted sesame oil
don't use the regular sesame oil won't
taste like anything but the toasted
sesame oil gives such a great classic
Chinese flavor and it's very strong so
be careful not to over season and there
